title: Law modifying and complementing Law establishing the Rwanda Law Reform Commission (RLRC) and Determining its Mission, Organization and Functioning
title_en: Law modifying and complementing Law establishing the Rwanda Law Reform Commission (RLRC) and Determining its Mission, Organization and Functioning

provisions.title: Article 5 - of Law n° 44/2013 of 16/06/2013
provisions.content: establishing the Rwanda Law Reform Commission (RLRC) and determining its mission, organization and functioning is modified and complemented follows: “The overall and permanent mission of RLRC shall be to review Rwandan laws with a view ensuring their development and reform. In particular, RLRC shall be responsible for: 1° analysing Rwandan laws and providing recommendations to relevant institutions for their improvement, updating and reform; 2° conducting studies designed to assess laws in force in the country in order to identify those that are not implemented, suggest the new ones that are necessary and advise relevant institutions accordingly; 3° ensuring 4° identifying laws provided for under the Constitution that are not yet put in place and preparing related draft bills; 5° preparing draft bills for laws that need be made or modified on the initiative RLRC or upon request by relevant institutions; 6° examining draft bills initiated by other institutions before they are submitted to the Cabinet; 7° contributing ideas on a private member‟s bill as initiated by a Deputy or a group Deputies upon request; 8° following up the consideration process 9° ensuring proper drafting and translation Rwandan laws in all official languages proper codification consolidation of Rwanda laws; and bills in the Parliament; throughout the legislative process starting from the preparation of draft bill to the publication of laws in the Official Gazette of the Republic of Rwanda; 10° identifying national laws in force to harmonized with principles that are provided for under international instruments ratified by Rwanda; 11° providing public institutions with advice 12° receiving and considering any proposals for reform of laws that are submitted by institution or any interested person. In order to fulfil its mission, RLRC shall collaborate with other public and private institutions, whether national or international well as national or international non-governmental organizations.” on legal matters and draft bill;

provisions.title: Article 2 - Responsibilities
provisions.content: Secretary of Cell of Executive The Executive Secretary of the cell shall have the following responsibilities: 1° perform daily administration; 2° monitor the performance of Communal Work supervising Committees at the cell level; 3° monitor activities of Land Committees; 4° perform civil status related functions and to provide other services provided by Law which are not offered at the Sector level; 5° collect basic health statistical data in the Cell and submit them to the Sector Executive Secretary; 6° prepare all reports requested from the Cell administration; 7° keep all documents of the Cell; 8° to be a rapporteur of the Consultative Committee on development of the Cell meetings; 9° manage finances and assets of the Cell; duties of the Cell 10° issue death certificates before burial, when the death was not happened to the Hospital, in collaboration with the respective Head of the Village; 11° issue burial authorization in case absence of authorization by an authorized doctor; 12° implement and monitor the implementation of programs resolved by competent higher authorities and of those resolved by the Cell Council; 13° perform any other duties assigned to him by competent authorities. In case of absence of the Cell Executive Secretary, he / she is replaced by a staff designated by the Sector Executive Secretary.

provisions.title: Article 10 - of Law n° 44/2013 of 16/06/2013
provisions.content: establishing the Rwanda Law Reform Commission (RLRC) and determining its mission, organization and functioning is modified and complemented follows: “The Council of Commissioners shall be the supreme authority of RLRC. The Council of Commissioners shall have the following responsibilities: 1° to approve draft bills 2° to adopt internal Rules and Regulations 3° to adopt the long-term strategic plan 4° to adopt the annual action plan of RLRC; 5° to adopt the draft budget proposal 6° to approve the annual activity report to introduced RLRC; RLRC; RLRC; RLRC; submitted to the Minister; 7° to make decisions on any other matters relating to the mission of RLRC.”

provisions.title: Article 11 - of Law n° 44/2013 of 16/06/2013
provisions.content: establishing the Rwanda Law Reform Commission (RLRC) and determining its mission, organization and functioning is modified and complemented follows: “The Council of Commissioners shall composed of seven (7) Commissioners including the Chairperson and Vice Chairperson. The Chairperson and Vice Chairperson must lawyers and perform their duties on a permanent basis for a term of office of five (5) years renewable. Other five (5) Commissioners performing their duties on a non-permanent basis shall serve for term of office determined by a Presidential Order. At least thirty per cent (30%) Commissioners must be females. of the Activities of Commissioners performing their duties on a permanent basis shall be incompatible with any other remunerated activity.”

provisions.title: Article 15 - of Law n° 44/2013 of 16/06/2013
provisions.content: establishing the Rwanda Law Reform Commission (RLRC) and determining its mission, organization and functioning is modified and complemented follows: “A member of the Council of Commissioners shall leave office under circumstances: one of the following 1° expiration of the term of office; 2° resignation in writing; 3° physical or mental incapacity ascertained by 4° being definitively sentenced to a term equal or exceeding six (6) months imprisonment without suspension of sentence; 5° failure to attend three (3) consecutive meetings of RLRC in one year without valid reasons; 6° assignment to new duties; 7° failure to fulfil his/her responsibilities approved by the Council of Commissioners; 8° when it is evident that he/she no longer fulfils the requirements considered at the time he/she was appointed as member of the Council of Commissioners; 9° he/she is convicted of the crime of genocide 10° he/she pleads guilty and confesses to the authorized medical doctor; ideology; crime of genocide; 11° death.”

provisions.title: Article 17 - of Law n° 44/2013 of 16/06/2013
provisions.content: establishing the Rwanda Law Reform Commission (RLRC) and determining its mission, organization and functioning is modified and complemented follows: “The Bureau of RLRC shall be composed of the Chairperson, Vice Chairperson and Secretary General of RLRC.”

provisions.title: Article 18 - of Law n° 44/2013 of 16/06/2013
provisions.content: establishing the Rwanda Law Reform Commission (RLRC) and determining its mission, organization and functioning is modified and complemented follows: “The Bureau of RLRC shall have the following responsibilities: 1° to lead activities of RLRC; 2° to organise meetings of the Council Commissioners; 3° to comply with and ensure the implementation of the resolutions of the Council of Commissioners; 4° to monitor relations between RLRC and other institutions; 5° to submit a quarterly activity report to the Council of Commissioners.”

provisions.title: Article 8 - Appointment of the Secretary General
Article 21 - of Law n° 44/2013 of 16/06/2013
provisions.content: establishing the Rwanda Law Reform Commission (RLRC) and determining its mission, organization and functioning is modified and complemented follows: The Secretary General of RLRC shall: “The Secretary General of RLRC shall appointed by a Presidential Order. 1° act as the Chief Budget Manager of RLRC; 2° work out the planning and the draft budget 3° act as the rapporteur of the meetings of the Council of Commissioners and the Bureau of RLRC; 4° follow up daily matters, especially those proposal of the RLRC; related to support services to RLRC; 5° compile activity reports of RLRC; 6° prepare the documents to be submitted 7° be the custodian of documents and books the Council consideration; of Commissioners for of RLRC; 8° perform such other duty related to RLRC mission as may be assigned by the Chairperson of RLRC. The position of the Secretary General shall incompatible with any other remunerated activity”.

provisions.title: Article 24 - of Law n° 44/2013 of 16/06/2013
provisions.content: establishing the Rwanda Law Reform Commission (RLRC) and determining its mission, organization and functioning is modified and complemented follows: of the Council “The Council of Commissioners shall hold ordinary meeting once in a quarter in the presence of at least four (4) members. It shall be convened and presided over by the Chairperson or the Vice-Chairperson in the absence of the Chairperson on their own initiative or upon request in writing, by at least three (3) members. Where necessary, an extraordinary meeting of the Council of Commissioners shall be convened following modalities referred to in the preceding paragraph. The Council of Commissioners shall examine items on the agenda and any other business upon request by the Chairperson or by three (3) members. The Council of Commissioners may invite to meetings any person with special expertise for advisory purpose. The invited person shall not have voting rights. He/she shall only take part in discussions on the items which he/she was requested to advise on. The internal rules and regulations of RLRC shall determine the modalities for the holding of the meeting of the Council of Commissioners.
